ticket.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions
ticket.original-body-html:
Currently when using different formats in a controller you have to be explicit with the respond_to.

ie:


def some_action
  respond_to do |format|
    format.html { do this }
    format.xml  { do this }
    format.json { do this }
  end
end

It seems that you should be able to just use format and have that automatically handle the responder. For example:


def some_action
    format.html { do this }
    format.xml  { do this }
    format.json { do this }
end

Attached is a simple patch by Brandon Keepers and myself to make this so. One limitation is that this won't work in before filters. We realize this may be desired, but feel it can be a separate patch and shouldn't affect the inclusion of this functionality for a controller action.

version.body-html:
Currently when using different formats in a controller you have to be explicit with the respond_to.

ie:


def some_action
  respond_to do |format|
    format.html { do this }
    format.xml  { do this }
    format.json { do this }
  end
end

It seems that you should be able to just use format and have that automatically handle the responder. For example:


def some_action
    format.html { do this }
    format.xml  { do this }
    format.json { do this }
end

Attached is a simple patch by Brandon Keepers and myself to make this so. One limitation is that this won't work in before filters. We realize this may be desired, but feel it can be a separate patch and shouldn't affect the inclusion of this functionality for a controller action.
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body:
Additional reasons for this patch:
* respond_to by itself gives no value besides supplying us with a format object * respond_to requires that an unnecessary level of nesting * respond_to is an abstraction that can be abstracted away
version.body-html:
Additional reasons for this patch:

  • respond_to by itself gives no value besides supplying us with a format object
  • respond_to requires that an unnecessary level of nesting
  • respond_to is an abstraction that can be abstracted away
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body:
+1
I think this is a great patch, removing code that provides no value and just adds noise. I don't see any downsides.
version.body-html:
+1

I think this is a great patch, removing code that provides no value and just adds noise. I don't see any downsides.
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body:
I would recommend changing the naming, instead to say: @@@ ruby def some_action respond_to.html { render ... } respond_to.json { render_json ... } respond_to.xml { render_xml ... } end @@@
You could easily implement this functionality by simply having respond_to return the format object if you don't pass it a block directly:
@@@ ruby def respond_to if block_given? # ... original respond_to ... else # ... just return the format object since we'll next be calling .html, .json, etc. end end @@@
version.body-html:
I would recommend changing the naming, instead to say:


def some_action
  respond_to.html {  render ... }
  respond_to.json {  render_json ... }
  respond_to.xml {  render_xml ... }
end

You could easily implement this functionality by simply having respond_to return the format object if you don't pass it a block directly:


def respond_to
  if block_given?
    # ... original respond_to ...
  else
    # ... just return the format object since we'll next be calling .html, .json, etc.
  end
end
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body:
This is great. I would add a dep warning to the old way and remove the old block way on the next release from there. That way we can get rid of the block check and some lines of code.
+1
version.body-html:
This is great. I would add a dep warning to the old way and remove the old block way on the next release from there. That way we can get rid of the block check and some lines of code.

+1
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body:
I updated the original patch with Daniel's suggestion of just making respond_to without a block, instead of introducing a new method "format" to the controller.
I like Amos' suggestion for deprecating using a block, but this is not included in this patch. It would be easy enough to add if the core team felt comfortable doing that.
The idea would be that:
@@@ respond_to do |format| format.html { # this becomes deprecated } end @@@
and
@@@ respond_to.html { # this becomes the new default } @@@
version.body-html:
I updated the original patch with Daniel's suggestion of just making respond_to without a block, instead of introducing a new method "format" to the controller.

I like Amos' suggestion for deprecating using a block, but this is not included in this patch. It would be easy enough to add if the core team felt comfortable doing that.

The idea would be that:


respond_to do |format|
 format.html { 
  # this becomes deprecated
 }
end

and


respond_to.html { 
  # this becomes the new default
}
version.title: Make #respond_to implicit in controller actions

version.body: Looks like the old behaviour is still around and the new doesn't work in rails3 beta3. Is this going to make it to rails3 or should it be reassigned to a future release ?
version.body-html: Looks like the old behaviour is still around and the new doesn't work in rails3 beta3. Is this going to make it to rails3 or should it be reassigned to a future release ?

version.body: respond_to block is a really unnecessary abstraction. +1
